prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
A US Army soldier stationed in South Korea has been detained in Russia, the US military says.

The Russian foreign ministry said the charges were not related to "politics or espionage", but to a "purely domestic crime".

The 34-year-old was not on official travel when he was held on 2 May in the city of Vladivostok, in Russia's Far East.

Sgt Black had been in the process of changing duty stations from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in the US state of Texas, according to a statement from the US Army.

But instead of returning to the US, he travelled through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons, US Army spokeswoman Cynthia Smith said in a statement.

According to Russian media, he was visiting a woman with whom he had a romantic relationship.

The soldier's mother, Melody Jones, confirmed to CBS that he was in Russia visiting his girlfriend.

"Please do not torture him [or] hurt him," Melody Jones said when asked about her message to the Russians.

Sgt Black enlisted as an infantryman in 2008 and was deployed to Iraq in 2009 and Afghanistan in 2013. He was most recently assigned to the Eighth Army, US Forces Korea at Camp Humphreys in South Korea.

He did not request official clearance and the defence department did not authorise his travel to China or Russia, the US Army said. There is no evidence he intended to remain in Russia.

The Russian interior ministry informed the US embassy in Moscow on 3 May that Sgt Black had been arrested a day earlier for theft of personal property.

He is being held at a pre-trial detention facility until his next hearing.

"The Army notified his family and the US Department of State is providing appropriate consular support to the Soldier in Russia," the US Army said in a statement on Monday.

National Security Council spokesman John Kirby told reporters the US is "aware of this case and other matters related to Russia".

At the White House briefing on Monday, Mr Kirby said he could not provide more details.

Russia is holding two other Americans. Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has been detained since March 2023 on espionage charges.

Former US Marine Paul Whelan was accused of spying and sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020.

Both men maintain their innocence, and the US government says the charges against them are baseless.
stories: A British Airways pilot has been detained in Morocco, the airline says. The 42-year-old was not on official duty when he was held on 10 June in the city of Marrakech, in Morocco's north. The pilot, who has been flying for the airline for over a decade, had been in the process of changing bases from London to Dubai, according to a statement from British Airways. However, instead of flying to Dubai, he travelled to Marrakech for personal reasons, the airline said. According to Moroccan media, he was visiting a woman with whom he had a romantic relationship. The pilot's wife, Sarah Taylor, confirmed to BBC that he was in Morocco visiting his girlfriend. "Please do not mistreat him," Sarah Taylor said when asked about her message to the Moroccans. The pilot has been held at a pre-trial detention facility until his next hearing.

A renowned chef was taken into custody in Paris, his restaurant's PR team announced. The 38-year-old culinary mastermind was not on official duty when he was arrested on 12 July in the city of Lyon, in eastern France. The chef, who has been running his Michelin-starred restaurant for over a decade, had been in the process of relocating from New York to Tokyo, according to a statement from the restaurant. However, instead of flying to Tokyo, he travelled to Lyon for personal reasons, the restaurant said. According to French media, he was visiting a former colleague with whom he had a close friendship. The chef's wife, Maria Rodriguez, confirmed to Le Figaro that he was in Lyon visiting his old friend. "Please do not misunderstand his intentions," Maria Rodriguez said when asked about her message to the French authorities. The chef has been held at a pre-trial detention facility until his next hearing.

The marine biologist, who has spent over 20 years studying the most endangered marine species, had been in the process of relocating from her research station to a state-of-the-art underwater observatory on a newly discovered coral reef, according to a statement from her organization. However, instead of boarding a research vessel to the site, she traveled to the location for personal reasons, her organization said. According to local authorities, she was visiting an old colleague with whom she had a close research partnership. The marine biologist's colleague, Dr. Maria Rodriguez, confirmed to Oceanic Times that she was at the site studying ancient sea creatures for a groundbreaking study. "Please do not misinterpret her intentions," Dr. Rodriguez said when asked about her message to the local authorities. The marine biologist has been held at a local research facility until her next hearing.
